line_1: An Ill, You may so soon retrieve?
Too faithful heart! thou never canst retrieve
line_2: O'er thy lost treasure still in silence grieve;

line_1: To move thy Pity, and thy Love retrieve.
line_2: Direct me how to make my Vows believ'd,

line_1: When Reuben's arts the hopeless youth retrieve,
line_2: The fatal stroke they now prepare to give,

line_1: When Reuben's arts the hopeless youth retrieve,
line_2: By thus advising, – let your brother live.

line_1: My first unblemish'd honour to retrieve:
line_2: The world, the boundless universe I'd give,

line_1: Old age in vain those pleasures wou'd retrieve,
line_2: Which youth alone can taste, alone can give;

line_1: Angiers to Honour straight, and Grace retrieve,
line_2: And Natures Faults, let Heav'en and you forgive:

line_1: Their credit thereby, and their trade to retrieve,
line_2: That again they may rail, and the nation believe.

line_1: That which I would, with Life itself retrieve.
line_2: The Present is but mean, which you receive,

line_1: That which I would, with Life itself retrieve.
line_2: Yet cost me more, than all the World can give,

line_1: "The time you've lost in crowds retrieve,
The Moments past, if Thou art wise, retrieve
line_2: With pleasant Mem'ry of the Bliss they gave.
The Fame of Verse, and Life to Virtue give;

line_1: A fancy'd Kind of Being to retrieve,
line_2: And in a Book, or from a Building live.

line_1: New organs, since ev'n art can these retrieve?
line_2: Why not? or why may not the soul receive
